page.title: 02BOLNHURST
page.content:
The 'modern' village of Bolnhurst lies around a cross-roads on the Bedford to Kimbolton road. This has developed, originally as a farming community in the past five hundred years and still retains numbers of cottages typical of the area, many of which though have been modernised.
The parish church is situated almost a mile from the present centre and indeed some way off the Thurleigh road from which it can be reached. It is thought that the church stood at the centre of the 'old' village which was abandoned after the Black Death and never re-occupied.
